results.title: Soulmate
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Fair Dinkum and Lincoln Douglas Hiatt
results.brief_description: Motifs of water and innocence lost abound in this short film about a troubled adult, Jordan, who is plagued by an image from childhood of a woman in red. Cast includes David Gray, Kim Trengrove and Timothy Fox. Music by David Bridie.

results.title: Soulcaking at Antrobus
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Every year at Hallwe’en a gang of men from the village of Antrobus in Cheshire perform a traditional play in the pubs and village halls of the neighbourhood. The film shows a performance at the Wheatsheaf, Antrobus on 12th November 1974, and tries to demonstrate what lies behind it

results.title: Soul Music: from Terry Pratchett's discworld. Parte two
results.brief_description: Great A’Tuin is a giant turtle, floating through space, and on his back stand four elephants, on their backs, there rests the Discworld. This is the setting for Terry Pratchett’s adventure, the ‘Discworld’. In this concluding parte of the story of The Band with Rocks In, the questions are answered; Did the Archchancellor do the rite stuff? Will Death imbibe enough alcohol to forget? And will he ever return to duty? Will The Band with Rocks In get to play a free festival? And can Susan save buddy from the music? This tape includes a twenty minute interview with Terry Pratchett.

results.title: Soul music: from Terry Pratchett's discworld. Parte one
results.brief_description: Great A’Tuin is a giant turtle, floating through space, and on his back stand four elephants, on their backs, there rests the Discworld. This is the setting for Terry Pratchett’s adventure, the ‘Discworld’. There is a new and addictive music on the disc! When Imp Y Celyn, a young harpist (who looks a bit elvish) arrives in Anhk Morpock, the town will never be the same again. He forms ‘The Band With Rocks In’ with his friends Lias and Glod and changes his name to Buddy. Meanwhile Susan St Helit has a problem, her Grandfather is Death, and he’s missing.

results.title: Soul collection - back to Stax
results.creator_credit: Midem Music, Clive Woods, Ben Sidran and Stanley Dorfman
results.brief_description: This concert, held in 1990, and filmed at the Palais De Festivale Hall in Cannes, France, is a celebration of the achievements of the legendary record company Stax Records. With a distribution deal from Atlantic Records, Stax produced artists that championed the sounds of soul music around the world. This live memorial concert includes performances from: Booker T and the MGs, Phil Upchurch, Carla Thomas, Eddie Floyd, Memphis Horns and Sam Moore.

results.title: SOS Galapagos Islands
results.creator_credit: Les Films du Centaure and Paul de Roubaix
results.brief_description: Shows the work being done by the Charles Darwin Foundation to preserve the Galapagos fauna. Shows te turtles, iguanas and some birds and discusses briefly their importance in Darwin’s research leading to his explanation of evolution. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: SOS
results.brief_description: Comical but scathing indictment of man’s age-old exploitation of women, presented via the historical theories of a mad professor who is convinced that women are temporary visitors from a far-away galaxy. Starring Maurizio Nichetti as the teacher. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Sorry book: Kutcha; Larry (A) [Reconciliation advertisements]
results.brief_description: These two short community advertisements (30 seconds each) were made to create awareness about the suffering of indigenous peoples as a result of forced removal from their families in the middle of twentieth century Australia. The audience is asked to consider the current impact experienced by these people today as a direct result of government policy whilst the Aboriginal people are still asking “why?”. Sign the “Sorry book” at www.apology.west.net.au.

results.title: Sorry
results.brief_description: 75 years later, the survivors and their descendants of the Coniston massacre invited my family to remember the past. I went to say sorry. I was the only member of my family to attend.
